title: iinet NBN frequent lag spikes and unstable ping

embed.description: BGP summary, routing, traceroute and ping for Internode's International IPv4 and IPv6 networks - AS4739.

body:
Hi there,

I am just wondering if anyone has any similar issues or any solutions to my problem.

I recently moved houses, and the current place that I live in has NBN access which is what I am using at the moment.

I frequently encounter lag spikes going from 12ms jumping to 500ms every couple of minutes in game.

I wonder if anyone else is encountering the same issue?

I am with iinet, previously I was using their VDSL2+ service and I encountered no lag issues.

However now, playing league is virtually impossible with the lags.

I did a speed test which show a ping of 3 ms, however the reality in game was nothing close.

I have heard that iinet sydney server does not connect to the league of legends server, but I am not sure what the real issue is.

I've attached my tracerroute, hopefully this will help.

Thanks in advance!

replies.body: Same Problems Here Man! No problems on the old broadband. Switched to NBN with iiNet and constant lag spikes every 10-15 seconds from 24 to 500+

The iinet tech suggested that I use an ethernet cable, and see if there are any difference in latency.
Surely enough, I get stable 12ms ping constantly.
Have you tried using a wired connection vs using wifi?

Kind regards.

Hey there,

Could you please do the following for me;

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.

Thanks for your reply,

I will try doing what you've mentioned above, however is it worth mentioning that, after I connected my computer via ethernet cable to my router, the latency is always stable at 12 ms.
My query now really : does NBN connects my game through something that is very different, if not completely different from ADSL or VDSL?
Apologies for the abstract terms, I am not very tech savvy.

Kind regards
